CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 6, 1954, pg. 14, reads: Westinghouse Colored Seniors Private Prom- Members of the Westinghouse High School Colored Seniors Club held their own private prom before graduation at the Penn-Lincoln Hotel Sunday.  The school had held its own graduation prom earlier.  Among the events were a late supper at the Greene Heather on Bennett Street, Homewood, at which time the club of Negro graduates presented their sponsor, Mrs. Leola Graham, with a lovely gift.  Among those present at the prom were Joyce Gambrell, secretary; Shirley Nance, vice president; Toussaint Gregory, society chairman; Janet Carey, treasurer; Ada Barbour, Betty Scott, Bernestine McClorey, Mrs. Leola Graham, sponsor, Esther McKeever, Betty Pittmon, LaRue Jackson, Donald Fleming, James Lewis, Maurice Jackson, Bertram Taylor, John Johnson, Raymond Toliver, Walter Davis, and Channing Jackson. Other Negro graduates (not shown) are Kathleen Nickelson, Barbara Jones and Shirley Powe, all members of the club. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of members of Westinghouse High School Colored Seniors Club including: Joyce Gambrell, Shirley Nance, Toussaint Gregory, Janet Carey, Ada Barbour, Betty Scott, Bernestine McClorey, sponsor Leola Graham, Esther McKeever, Betty Pittmon, LaRue Jackson, Donald Fleming, James Lewis, Maurice Jackson, Bertram Taylor, John Johnson, Raymond Toliver, Walter Davis, and Channing Jackson, gathered for private prom at Penn-Lincoln Hotel
